we are very excited to welcome M Wester

there's a lot of things as a startup

that's planning and like with many

would be a missed opportunity not to
take the action of planning seriously so
what is an operating plan like what do I
even mean by this I think from a
business context it's pretty simple like
you're going to hear me say this over
and over but it's what are you doing
what's everyone doing how much does it
cost when are they doing it how are they
being measured it's those really simple
questions that you just do on repeat to
know that you're acting on a plan and
just for a quick example I know that you
all do this in your daily lives all the
time so you know I have up here planning
a trip moving to a new city training for
a race like an example of this I ran a
marathon years ago and I know there's a
whole training plan right many months
long you have to know when are you doing
your long runs what is the route for
your runs what is your plan for rest and
Recovery um you have to have feedback
loops in your plan because what if you
have an injury what if you something
goes wrong or you're getting sore like
you have to be able to take in that
information and iterate on your plan and
so that is a very basic example but I
just use it to emphasize that like you
all do this all the time in your lives
and it's just kind of taking that and
being you know one step more intentional
about it when it comes to the business
the other thing I will say is uh your
race day might be like in my my analogy
there like your race day might be like a
token launch or like a really big
product launch or something and so
working backwards to what those that
requires is just a really important
thought process before we dig a Little
Deeper one thing to distinguish so the

talk about that today because as
Founders that's really your number one
job and you've probably all nailed it
pretty well because you're in CSX like
you've you've been able to convince
investors to get behind your vision and
and see the world through your lens and
so now that next step is really how do
you take that vision and put a very
actionable plan behind it and get your
team no matter how big it is to operate
on that same plan so again I'm going to
say it a bunch of times who's doing what
by when how much does it cost how are
you measuring it these are the things
you're going to hear over and over so
some key components of a good operating
plan the thing here that I think it's
worth mentioning is like you shouldn't
be overly academic about an operating
plan and don't overthink it um there are
a lot of Frameworks out there that talk
about all sorts of best practices for
building a plan and we're going to
actually go through some templates today
we're going to you actually have some
that we handed out and we're going to go

actually like the act of putting
something on paper and being able to
clearly articulate again like people
cost timing and ownership who's doing

so I wouldn't get overly concerned about
that where do things go wrong the thing
that I see most if I so I sort of
bucketed this into three loose
categories of mistakes but if I could
only put one bullet point on the slide
it would be the first one and what I
mean by being overly optimistic is that
information is changing all the time and
what you may do is set out a plan and
the plan has all these dependencies
right okay we want to Launch this
product in order to launch this product
we have to hire this these two engineers
and then after we launch it we think
revenue is going to go up and to the
right and like we have to hire this
marketing person to do this and it's got
all these things that sort of layer it
into a cohesive plan but if you're late
in even hiring those
engineers and then you don't shift the
rest of the downstream plan you're going
to miss deadlines and you're going to be
somehow surprised by that so so I will
tell you that everything takes longer
than you think generally as a good rule
of thumb and you should work that into
your mentality of like if you miss a
first milestone in your plan don't
assume that all the other Milestones
you're going to hit because if there's
dependencies you're going to have to
push them all out or rework how you're
thinking about something so you should
be optimistic you're Founders and you
have to be but also you have to be
realistic and know when to incorporate
those changes into your plan it's like
being agile and being flexible I think
that's really important and that's where
things go wrong a lot second category
here lack of focus um I think lack of
focus and not sequencing are two sort of
interrelated things many of you may have
a lot of ideas of what you can do with
the business and it's exciting and
you've got a lot of things you want to
work on and that's better than not
having ideas I would take that any day
but the problem is you can't do it all
at once and if you do you're going to
really damage your cash burn and the
focus of your team so what I would do is
think about sort of that strategic
sequencing of opportunities and instead
of doing multiple things at once um the
power of sequencing is maybe one thing
unlocks the capability to do something
else so if you can work on a technology
or you can work on um a product launch
that buys you new users or gets you
Revenue that sort of unlocks the
opportunity to go do something else that
leverages those users or leverages that
technology and so think about the order
in which you're doing things so that you
are not doing all your bets at once and
kind of spending both your money and
your focus time that's another thing
where things go wrong and I and I think
a sign of this by the way is like if you
are saying if I asked you like what's
your number one priority in the business
and you say your number one priority and
then I say how's everyone spending their
time and that number one priority is
only getting I don't know like 30% of
the time or something like that's a oh
huh wait a minute are we actually acting
in what we think we should be doing and
you got to reconcile that the third one
here is just you'd be surprised how
often you can lay out a great plan if
you're not measuring it or monitoring it
it doesn't matter it's just going to go
in the garbage because you don't even
know how you're doing on it or like how
to really adjust sequencing one thing to
remember there is if you are saying I'm
going to do this later sequencing does
not mean you're not going to do
something and I've seen that be like
scary for people of like oh I want to do

no it just means not now and so think
about like okay I can do this thing I

I'm going to wait six months to do it
because I need to focus on something

Hardware software costs you know license
